availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Sweatnam. Father of Cordelia Sweatnam, John Sweatnam, Rosabell Sweatnam, Mary T. Swearnam, and William B. Sweatnam. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia in Johnson County as surgeon from May 21, 1864 to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, p. 174A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 2-3.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 894.
Find A Grave, "Dr Hamilton Steven ‘Uncle Doctor’ Swetnam (1818-1893)," Memorial #39609205, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/39609205# (accessed October 9, 2018).
